result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua T Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua T Thompson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: ORDER DENYING THE PETITION FOR RETURN OF PROPERTY, signed and filed.
Petitioner Joshua T Thompson in court.  Jennifer K Rhodes appeared for the State of Wisconsin. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIES THE PETITION FOR RETURN OF PROPERTY.
Return of property hearing at 12-23-2015 08:30 am
Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office Inventory # NONE PROVIDED.
Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court ordered defendant to pay $100.00 FINE plus all applicable court costs and fees by October 24, 2016 or to be docketed as a civil judgment, cash bail to apply.

Court ordered defendant provide DNA sample after today's proceedings. Court ordered no new law violations.
.
Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.
.
Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Joshua T Thompson in court with attorney Scott Douglas Connors.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Joshua T Thompson in court with attorney Scott Douglas Connors.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.  Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joshua T Thompson in court with attorney Scott Douglas Connors.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status of counsel, new counsel present at first appearance.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joshua T Thompson in court pro-se.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defendant needs additional time to retain private counsel.   Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 07-07-2015 at 01:30 pm.

As a further condition of bail:
No firearms
No dangerous weapons

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joshua T Thompson in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-106

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  

Defendant informs he will be retaining counsel.

Court orders case adjourned to Branch 37 for a Pretrial Conference.
